repnme.cdata!:
Cape Verde - Public Sector Reform and
            Capacity Building Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, and institutional development
            impacts are high. Lessons convey that often times, and
            contrary to current Bank practices of starting an operation
            with institutional reforms, to increase the possibility of
            downsizing, followed by capacity building, it may be
            advantageous to pay attention to the client's
            arguments. In this case, the government demanded immediate
            actions, to take full advantage of the pluralistic momentum
            of changes, and guided this approach, to reach a successful
            capacity building stage. However, it was felt that some
            missing elements within the economic management component,
            could have been useful at the outset of the project, such as
            the need to address budget formulation, and execution, as
            well as emphasizing transparency, and accountability.
            Finally, assessing the impact of the project, particularly
            the development impact of capacity building, may be
            difficult to assess in the short term, and, the long-term
            impact can only be measured in terms of increased
            productivity, and efficiency over many years. However, it is
            possible - and necessary - to monitor accuracy, and quality,
            i.e., through benchmarks of effectiveness, least-costs, and
            benefits of the training.

18153531.projn:
CV-Pub. Sector Reform And Capacity Building

repnme.cdata!:
Cape Verde - Public Sector Reform and
            Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The major objective of the Public Sector
            Reform and Capacity Building Project is to assist the
            government to implement its long-term public sector
            institutional development strategy. The project will be a
            specific investment credit consisting of five components:
            (a) civil service modernization; (b) municipal
            strengthening; (c) economic management support; (d) legal
            and judicial upgrading; and (e) public procurement reform.
            The first component will provide assistance to reform and
            modernize the civil service by providing short-term advisory
            services and equipment to the Ministry of Public
            Administration, training for staff from various parts of the
            civil service, and training and retraining for voluntary
            departees from the civil service. The second component will
            provide assistance for building local capacity to
            participate and to manage through the provision of training,
            equipment, short-term advisory services and support for
            operational studies for all 15 municipalities, and where
            appropriate, the Ministry of Internal Administration. The
            third component will support and strengthen economic
            management capacity by assisting with operational studies
            and public information campaigns, and providing advisory
            services, training, equipment, library support to the
            Ministries of Economic Coordination, Finance, and
            Communications and their major agencies as well as the
            private media. The fourth component will provide assistance
            for legal and judicial reforms and modernizing the justice
            system through the provision of training, equipment and
            materials, textbooks and printing, and advisory services for
            the Ministry of Justice and Labor and its major agencies
            including the Judiciary, the Registrar of Companies, and the
            Registrar of Deeds as well as legal services for key
            ministries. The fifth component will provide assistance for
            continued reform of public procurement by providing
            training, short-term advisory services and equipment to the
            Public Procurement Department and selected administration departments.
